intro: Leucheria nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stem leucheria, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Its slender, hairless stems and delicate foliage make it a distinctive yet understated member of its ecosystem.
